Package com.example.scandal

Class QRCode

java.lang.Object
com.example.scandal.QRCode
public class QRCode extends Object
QRCode Class is used to stored a QR code in various forms manages QR generation and a various QR related objects, uses Bitmap to store QR images and a String for the Token stored in the QR token.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    generateQR(android.widget.ImageView img, String token)
    Takes the ImageView that the QR should be generated in and makes BitMap of a QR code that encodes the token to fit in the designated area and stores it in the QRPic attribute which can be accessed via it's getter, as well as sets the QRToken attribute to the token inputted Sources: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n8HdrLYL9DA https://github.com/journeyapps/zxing-android-embedded
    boolean

  • Method Details

    • generateQR

      public boolean generateQR(android.widget.ImageView img, String token)
      Takes the ImageView that the QR should be generated in and makes BitMap of a QR code that encodes the token to fit in the designated area and stores it in the QRPic attribute which can be accessed via it's getter, as well as sets the QRToken attribute to the token inputted Sources: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n8HdrLYL9DA https://github.com/journeyapps/zxing-android-embedded
      Parameters:
      img - a ImageView to get a reference for the size of the QR
      token - a String Token which will be encoded into the generated QR
      Returns:
      boolean of whether a QR was successfully generated

    • getQRFromImage

      public boolean getQRFromImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap, int rotationDegree)
      Gets a QR code from an image inputted as a bitmap. Needs the rotation degrees of the image inorder to work. Method may need to be reworked to an activity later.
      Parameters:
      bitmap - a Bitmap which represents the image that contains a Bitmap
      rotationDegree - rotation degree of the image stored in the Bitmap
      Returns:
      boolean whether a QR was successfully read from the image. Sources: https://developers.google.com/ml-kit/vision/barcode-scanning/android

    • getQRToken

      public String getQRToken()
      gets the QR's token
      Returns:
      String token attribute

    • getQRPic

      public android.graphics.Bitmap getQRPic()
      gets the QR's bitmap
      Returns:
      image stored as a Bitmap
